newsitem.title: USA: McAfee recovers after recent tech weakness.
newsitem.headline: McAfee recovers after recent tech weakness.

text.p: Shares of McAfee Associates Inc showed signs of recovery Friday after the recent wave of technology selling which battered many small capitalization stocks, analysts said.
McAfee, a computer software producer, gained 2-1/2 to 42-1/2 in heavy afternoon trading.
While the entire technology sector has been hard hit lately, some bellwether stocks such as Intel Corp and Microsoft Corp fared better than smaller firms such as McAfee, analysts said.

"There's been some volatility to the tech sector as a whole. And there has been a shift to some larger cap tech stocks at the expense of the smaller, less visible stocks," said John Geurkink, a research associate at Bear Stearns.
McAfee's shares have been volatile since it hit a high of 64-1/2 on February 14. McAfee's shares sank as low as 38-1/2 on March 19 and have risen steadily in the past two sessions.
McAfee's fundamentals remain strong, making it an attractive buy in the wake of the recent selloff in technology stocks, analysts said.
"The correction upwards is overdue and justified," said John Powers, an analyst with Robertson Stephens.
McAfee's stock also may have gotten a boost this week due to its recent announcement about the release of a remote diagnostic software product, analysts said.
